ns2:attribute.ns1:desc:
Specifies a unique name for the external syslog server.
Example: Server at Headquarters
Specifies the protocol to be used for sending data to the external server. TLS over TCP is currently the only supported alternative.

Specifies the domain name, the IPv4 address or the IPv6 address of the external log server. The address is followed by an optional port number. The default port is 6514.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The address and port are separated by a colon. Examples: 192.168.1.2 192.168.1.2:50005 (address and port)
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in the specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullets 1and 2. The address and port are separated by a colon and by brackets. Examples: 2001:db8::1 [2001:db8:0:1]:50005 (address and port)
The input format for a domain name is as defined in the specification RFC 952.
When address resolution is requested and when the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. This means that a host name definition in the DNS server must not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Instead, use two separate host names: one that resolves to the IPv4 address and one that resolves to the IPv6 address.
